answers.answer: Romania offers various types of support including help-lines, information on documents and border crossings, guidance for travel to EU states, care for minors, accommodation assistance, money exchange services, emergency help, and regional centers for asylum seekers.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Individuals can contact help-lines such as CNRR at 0040 730 073 170, UNHCR at +40723653651, IOM Romania at 021 210 3050, and the National Line against Trafficking in Persons Romania at 0 800 800 678 or +4021.313.31.00.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Ukrainians fleeing war at home are welcomed to Romania Help-lines'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian nationals need to present a valid passport at the border crossing to enter Romania and stay for up to 90 days.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Documents'.

answers.answer: If individuals do not have documents of any kind, they can enter Romania as an asylum seeker.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Documents'.

answers.answer: The two main ways to enter Romania are with the right of short-stay or as an asylum seeker, and one can also apply for asylum within Romania at a later point.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Documents'.

answers.answer: From Ukraine, Halmeu, Sighetu Marmației, Siret, and Isaccea border points can be used to cross into Romania. Individuals can also reach Romania through the Republic of Moldova.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Border points you can use to cross into Romania'.

answers.answer: Real-time waiting times for every border crossing into Romania can be found at https://www.politiadefrontiera.ro/ro/traficonline/.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Border points you can use to cross into Romania'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian citizens with a biometric passport do not need a visa to travel to the EU. For specific conditions of travel to an EU Member State, it is recommended to contact the embassy of the destination country.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Traveling to other Member States of the European Union'.

answers.answer: All unaccompanied children can cross the border from Ukraine to Romania, and the General Directorates for Social Assistance and Child Protection (DGASPC) from each county are authorized to care for them.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Minors entering Romania'.

answers.answer: If you suspect or witness a child abuse case in Romania, you should call 119, which is a unique national telephone number for such cases.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Minors entering Romania'.

answers.answer: Individuals needing support in finding temporary accommodation or wanting to provide space to help vulnerable people can access 'Un Acoperiș'.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Accommodation'.

answers.answer: At BCR (Romanian Commercial Bank), Ukrainian Hryvnia can be exchanged to Romanian Lei at the BNR exchange rate, up to 2,000 lei per person/Ukrainian passport. This offer is valid only for people with Ukrainian passports, and 11 BCR branches in border areas are available 24/7.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Money'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian citizens can get assistance in financial-banking services by calling 0373514244 or writing to suport.linia1@bcr.ro. BCR offers 0 lei costs for transactions at POS and ATM with Ukrainian cards, 0 lei commission for opening and administering a current account, and 0 fees for inter and intra bank payments.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Money'.

answers.answer: Individuals can request or provide emergency resources such as food, products, clothing, tents, transportation, or volunteers through 'Sprijin de Urgență'.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Emergency help'.

answers.answer: Regional Centers for Asylum Seekers are located in Rădăuți, Maramureș, Galați, București, Timișoara, and Giurgiu, with specific addresses, telephone, fax, and email contacts provided for each.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopopoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Regional Centers for Procedures and Accommodation for Asylum Seekers'.
